citeinfo.origin: Metropolitan Council and the U.S. Census Bureau
citeinfo.title: Profile of Selected Housing Characteristics for Census Tracts: 2000

descript.abstract:
Summary File 3 Data Profile 4 (SF3 Table DP-4) for Census Tracts in the Minneapolis-St. Paul 7 County metropolitan area is a subset of the profile of selected housing characteristics for 2000 prepared by the U. S. Census Bureau.
This table (DP-4) includes: Units in Structure, Year Structure Built, Rooms, Year Householder Moved into Unit, Vehicles Available, House Heating Fuel, Selected Characteristics, Occupants per Room, Value, Mortgage Status and Selected Monthly Owner Costs, Selected Monthly Owner Costs as a Percentage of Household Income in 1999, Gross Rent, Gross Rent as a Percentage of Household Income in 1999
US Census 2000 Demographic Profiles: 100-percent and Sample Data
The profile includes four tables (DP-1 thru DP-4) that provide various demographic, social, economic, and housing characteristics for the United States, states, counties, minor civil divisions in selected states, places, metropolitan areas, American Indian and Alaska Native areas, Hawaiian home lands and congressional districts (106th Congress). It includes 100-percent and sample data from Census 2000. The DP-1 table is available as part of the Summary File 1 (SF 1) dataset, and the other three tables are available as part of the Summary File 3 (SF 3) dataset.
The US Census provides DP-1 thru DP-4 data at the Census tract level through their DataFinder search engine. However, since the Metropolitan Council and MetroGIS participants are interested in all Census tracts within the seven county metropolitan area, it was quicker to take the raw Census SF-1 and SF-3 data at tract levels and recreate the DP1-4 variables using the appropriate formula for each DP variable. This file lists the formulas used to create the DP variables.
descript.purpose: This table can be joined to the 2000 Census Tract spatial dataset using the TRACT00 field (11 digit State,County,Tract code). This will allow users to create maps and conduct spatial analyses with the data in this table.

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

citeinfo.title: Census Geography 2000 -TIGER Tracts, Census Geography 2000 - TLG Aligned Tracts

attracc.attraccr:
Please see the technical documentation from the Census 2000 Demographic Profiles web site:
http://censtats.census.gov/pub/Profiles.shtml
Please read 'DDP variable formulas for tract level data.xls' for detailed description of the formulas used to extract the raw Census data at tract levels to recreate the DP variables.

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area is covered.

spdoinfo.indspref: TRACT00: 11 character Census Tract code for 2000 Census (State FIPS, County FIPS, 6 digit Tract code).
spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One file for 7 county metropolitan area

overview.eaover:

overview.eadetcit:
U.S. Census Bureau, Census 2000 Table DP-4. Profile of Selected Economic Characteristics: 2000
http://www.census.gov/prod/cen2000/doc/ProfileTD.pdf
'DP variable formulas for tract level data.xls' describes the variables and formulas used to extract from the raw Summary File (SF) data and recreate the DP variables at the Census Tract level.

distinfo.distliab: NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). THE GIS DATA ARE PROVIDED TO YOU AS IS AND WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY AS TO THEIR PERFORMANCE, MERCHANTABILITY, OR FITNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE. The GIS Data were developed by the Metropolitan Council for its own internal business purposes. The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.
